questions.question_text: Which statement about the FSSO collector agent timers is true?

choices.D: The IP address change verify interval monitors the server IP address where the collector agent is installed.
choices.A: The workstation verify interval is used to periodically check if a workstation is still a domain member.
choices.C: The user group cache expiry is used to age out the monitored groups.
choices.B: The dead entry timeout interval is used to age out entries with an unverified status.

discussion.content:
B is correct : https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=FD31876
In C : user group cache hitsory don't exist

Selected Answer: CD
right answer should be C&D

Selected Answer: AD
a&d are correct
C & D are correct - FGT_Infrastructure-6.2, p. 243

questions.question_text: Which two statements describe WMI polling mode for the FSSO collector agent? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The NetSessionEnum function is used to track user logoffs.
choices.C: The collector agent does not need to search any security event logs.
choices.A: WMI polling can increase bandwidth usage in large networks.
choices.D: The collector agent uses a Windows API to query DCs for user logins.

choices.B: The user's personal certificate signed by a private internal CA

discussion.content: D is correct - FGT_Security-6.2, p. 334. - certificate for the example.com is self-signed, so FortiGate has to use its untrusted sertificate

comments.content: On this question we have the information "The web server's certificate was signed by a private internal CA" and in the end "no certificates were imported to Fortigate". It means that is not a Webserver that Fortigate trusts, so it will used the Untrusted Certificate to exchange data with client and apply full ssl inspection.
because C says "certificate signed by Fortinet_CA_SSL" and that is not true it is a self signed cert ( signed by fortigate it self). That is why it is D.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

An employee connects to https://example.com using a web browser. The web server's certificate was signed by a private internal CA. The FortiGate that is inspecting this traffic is configured for full SSL inspection.
The exhibit shows the configuration settings for the SSL/SSH inspection profile that is applied to the policy that is invoked in this instance. All other settings are set to defaults. No certificates have been imported into FortiGate.
Which certificate is presented to the employee's web browser?

discussion.content: B & D are correct - FGT_Security-6.2, p. 334

questions.question_text:
An administrator is attempting to allow access to https://fortinet.com through a firewall policy that is configured with a web filter and an SSL inspection profile configured for deep inspection.
Which two actions can eliminate the certificate error generated by deep inspection? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Configure fortinet.com access to bypass the IPS engine.
choices.B: Manually install the FortiGate deep inspection certificate as a trusted CA.
choices.A: Implement firewall authentication for all users that need access to fortinet.com.
choices.D: Configure an SSL-inspection exemption for fortinet.com.
